title: The cake is 123.56% not a lie!

data.title: The cake is 123.56% not a lie!
data.solution:
import re

message = input()
digits = re.findall(r"[1-9]", message)
if not digits:
    print("(no secret message)")
else:
    words = re.findall(r"[A-Za-z]+", message)
    print(" ".join(words[int(digit) - 1] for digit in digits))

testCases.title: No punctuation, digits at the end
No punctuation, digits at the end
No punctuation, digits at the start
testCases.testIn: 123 I love you trying to be smart

testCases.title: No punctuation, digits at the start
Punctuation, digits at the start
testCases.testIn: 4136 Cats should not eat, especially humans!

testCases.title: Punctuation, digits throughout
testCases.testIn: There is 1 secret message here, not 65, i'm not mad!

testCases.title: Repetition
testCases.testIn: It's about doing the loop 4666666666666 times.
testCases.testOut: doing loop loop loop loop loop loop loop loop loop loop loop loop

testCases.title: Repetition
testCases.testIn: 666 are the digits of the devil, damn the one who says 777!
testCases.testOut: devil devil devil damn damn damn

testCases.title: No message
testCases.testIn: Today's lottery numbers are nine, seven, zero, ...

testCases.title: No message
testCases.testIn: If there are digits here, knock three times.

testCases.title: No message (with zeroes)
testCases.testIn: There is 0 chances I'm placing a message here.

testCases.title: Complete
testCases.testIn: Do not execute order 066, nor kill!

testCases.title: Complete
testCases.testIn: The cake is 123.560% not a lie!

data.outputDescription: <<First line:>> The secret message, or {{(no secret message)}}.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A secret message is hidden within the provided message, and it's up to you to find out what it is!

Within every message are decimal digits from 1 to 9, that may or may not be adjacent. You must collect them and, for each digit, get the word for which the digit is a 1-based index.

A word is a collection of adjacent uppercase (from A to Z) and lowercase (from a to z) letters. For example:

* The has 1 word, being The;
* Don't has 2 words, being Don and t;
* Rendez-vous is 2 words, being Rendez and vous;
* 100% has 0 words;
* fun! has 1 word, being fun.

If present, 0s are part of the ignored characters.

You must print the secret message, as the words of the index separated by spaces. If there are no decimal digits from 1 to 9 within the message, then there is no secret message, and you must print (no secret message).

A few examples:

* With hello universe or world 14, there is a secret message, you should print hello world
* With 123 i love you trying to be smart, there is a secret message, you should print i love you
* With a3, b2, c1, there is a secret message, you should print c b a
* With There is no digits here., there is no secret message, you should print (no secret message)
Input
First line: The message to process.
Output
First line: The secret message, or (no secret message).
Constraints
0 < length(message) < 250
Example
Input
Hello universe or world 14
Output
Hello world
